content:
Oocyte
Injection:
Protein
Labelling
Spin RNA precipitate in microfuge 30 min. Pour off
rinse pellet with 70% and dry.
Resuspend RNA in 4 ul H2O. Take lul count in ACS.
Take 1 ul 32P-GTP count in ACS. Calculate mass of
RNA transcribed (under these conditions should be
about 2 ug). Freeze remainder of RNA on dry ice.
Place frog on ice about 1/2 hr. Surgically remove
piece of ovary, and place it in OR2 medium. suture
frog. 
Defolliculate oocytes >1200 um (hopefully oocytes
will have white band surrounding equator denoting
Stage 6 oocytes; if so use these). Defolliculate
about 20 oocytes.
GOGD 
Inject 5-10 ng RNA into 20 oocytes. Set oocytes in
OR2 and allow to incubate about 6InxL to overnight
(note: all of these procedures using 32P labelled
RNA should be done behind a protective plexiglass
shield; although only about 20 nl of RNA will be
injected per oocyte this can still result in a
surprising amount of radioactive emission).
To prepare 3HLeucine for injection, dry down 1mCi of
3HLeu in speed Vac (should be done at least 1 day
prior to use because it will take a long time).
Resuspend pellet in 25 ul unlabelled 1.5 mM leucine.
(note: leucine is used as a label because it
comprises approx. 10% of the oocyte's protein
content, and is a good representative amino acid.
The addition of cold leucine to the label allows you
to control the cell's leucine pool size, and insure
a more gradual and complete incorporation of label).
Inject 5 RNA injected oocytes, and 5 control oocytes
with 15 nl of labelled AJL Incubate in OR2 for 1
hour to incorporate label.
Transfer oocytes to clean microcentrifuge tube,
transferring as little media as possible. Add 0.75
ml of 50 mM mM Homogenize oocytes
completely by pipeting with pastuer pipet. Add
another 0.75 ml buffer, mix, and centrifuge 5 min.
in microfuge (this treatment removes the large mass
of yolk which will pellet to the bottom. Remove
supernatant, and add 11 vol. Precipitate
overnight.
